This place look ok but the food is terrible. My friends and me ordered sandwiches and they were horrible. I have not had such food for a long time. Sandwiches were greasy that five napkins got soaked in grease. The taste was similar. My pastrami was replaced by bacon and was very chewy. I am not sure why this place have such high ratings. My review is based on 3 different sandwiches that we ordered.

Came here last weekend with the family because I've been craving for some mahi mahi for awhile. We ordered 2 mahi mahi dinners, butterfish, and chilli with spaghetti. Mahi mahi was good as always! Great portions 2 people can share a plate, but leftovers taste just as good the next day. The butterfish was great, especially because the portion was bigger than it was in the past. It was the frat time we ordered chilli. Can't go wrong with that either. After all, it's Zippys! Can't believe we didn't know  that after all year years.. Oh, and to top things off we ordered a hot fudge sundae. It was great! My 3 year old ate most if it though lol. Service was good also. The waiter was very friendly

I really like this place, a lot of good specials, :). Granted I did not try the oxtail soup as mentioned by everyone, but I did get their $8.95 prime rib special.  The prime rib was really tender and cooked medium rare like we wanted.  It also came with unlimited salad/fruit bar, and a cherry ice cream dessert.  All that for $8.95 is definitely one of the best non-graveyard deals in vegas.  The service was nice too and I will definitely come back for the oxtail soup next time i return to vegas!

Holy crap! Why didn't I know about this place sooner?
AWESOME $7.95 prime rib special:
http://www.thecal.com/whats-new/news/prime-rib-special-$7.95
Includes all you can eat salad bar.

We waited in line however, for at least 30 minutes.  Which sucked, but well worth the wait, I think.
Never seen so many Asians and Hawaiians under one roof. 
Park in The California parking structure, make sure to get your parking ticket validated for free parking.

I will DEFINITELY be going back OFTEN!! :D

When we're in town we like to come here for the breakfast they have the best pancake ever it's always cooked perfectly light golden, taste so yummy!!! We also get the breakfast buffet and thats pretty good too. The Steak special is also really good & cooked perfect. Oxtail soup is the best, but you have to get here early.

Graveyard menu is the best here!!

By far the best Oxtail Soup here!  They start to serve is at 11pm-6pm or until the run out for the night.  I did come once really late and they ran out of it.  If you decide to come at 11pm...you should come a little earlier.  There is always a long line for Oxtail Soup right at 11pm.  The broth is so flavorful and the meat just falls off the bone!  Writing this review is making me want to have a bowl now!   I wish there was a place here that makes the oxtail soup as good as this place.

Solid not spectacular. but for the price what can you expect? $47 for all four of us. Made the mistake of not getting some Hawaiian fare. Tried the 9.99 Prime Rib special. Asked for au jus on the side because I was warned by a fellow diner that they like to drench the PR. When it arrived, it was still drenched. Salad bar and dessert included saved the meal. I'll come back, but next time I must try the lau lau or something teriyaki.
I came here during my most recent trip to Vegas last June and found out they raised prices on everything. Since when is oxtail soup $9.99?! Used to be $4.99 :( That's highway robbery.

Local local   Local. When you're Kamaaina and you visit California hotel. You have to come to the Market Street Cafe it's like
Your pilgrimage to Mecca.  The line moves fast. 

Returned again and still the best oxtail soup.

First time I came here was over the summer of last year. Boyfriend was craving Oxtail soup and wanted me to try it since I have never had it in my life! 

It was a little after 2:00am when we arrived here, and no joke this place was hopping. The line was long and the wait was about 15mins to get a table. Everyone was there from old to the very young. The hostess was nice as she sat us toward the back of the dining room. Now I am not one to complain about where I eat, but some of you might turn your nose up and the place. First of all, this is not new Vegas, its old Vegas. Things are well taken care of in this place (think Denny's) but have an older feel. They have midnight specials, which cannot be beat by anyone else around town! Cheap prices on good cooking!

Our waiter was nice, as he brought us water and our silverware! Boyfriend ordered two bowls of their oxtail soup and two sides of rice. 

When the waiter brought our bowls to the table, all I could think was. How am I going to finish all this? There sitting in front of me was a piping hot and smelling delicious oversized bowl of  the tenderness looking meat sitting on the bone (psst don't tell anyone but I found out that it isn't really ox meat it's the meat from a cow)with cilantro, carrots and mushrooms.

 The side bowl of sticky rice was piled high. The rice was okay did not eat much of it, but the soup was fully loaded with flavor definitely leaving the bones in makes the broth that much better. 

Since this was my first time eating the meat from the soup, I was not as graceful as my boyfriend was while eating it. Instead, I tore into it with a knife and fork and when that did not work, I used my fingers to get the meat off the bone. Yes, I am not happy to admit that but just could not think of putting the bone near my mouth and chomp chomping away at it! 

Not 100% full we decided on having a little sweet snack before leaving. Ordered the banana fritters, which were pretty filling as I could only managed to eat two before being totally full!

Make a note people before coming here: Oxtail soup is not served during the day it is only served after 11:00pm...  

This place is totally worth going to DTLV for late at night!

This place is like a Denny's, except more mom & pop feel. The food is average. 

Had the oxtail soup (that's what everyone suggested). The soup was plenitful and came with a side of rice. It was good, but definitely not the best.

The saimin soup was good, but again, not the best. It tastes kind of like Vietnames Hu Tieu, except a little bit blander. This is good for after a long day/night in Vegas.

A bit far from the strip.

And the 11P-5A specials aren't that cheap.....

I have to have the salad bar with my meal.  The kimchi cucumbers, broccoli salad and tofu salad are the best.  Some favorites are also misoyaki butterfish, the prime rib dinner special (that comes with cherries jubilee), fried won ton appetizer, oxtail soup (after 11pm)....

My friend has been raving about this place, specifically the oxtail soup...so we decided to make a stop at midnight. Make sure you call in advance just in case. They start serving at 11pm, but I guess they have ran out before. You don't want to make the trip all the way out there for nothing. 
Location/ambience: dive cafe located in a grungy Asian-dominated hotel in downtown. A type of place I would go for a specific dish and that would probably be it. I could totally see this place in Triple D. 
Service: lots of older Asian servers. Pretty friendly. Our service was fast   Apparently the wait could be really long on some night. No complaints today. 
Food: the server knew right away what we were after. 5 oxtail soups. We also threw in a NY steak plate since it was only $6.99. Soup came out with. 5-10 mins. Good size portion with 3-4 big fatty pieces of oxtail. Also comes with 1 big scoop of rice and side of cilantro and ginger. The soup base flavor was delicious. I love how the cilantro and ginger favors accompanied it. There were some veggies included. Once u dump the rice in, it becomes a very hearty stew. The oxtail was a tad tougher than I would have liked. I wonder if we had come in the early morning, would it have been more tender (longer cooking time). It also got s tad messy trying to extract the meat from the bone. But the flavor was just so good. Every bite was delicious. You definitely get food coma after. The NY STeak was just ok. But for $7! How can u complain. 
Value: I thought was excellent. $10 for this dish in Vegas is good and worth it. 

I kinda wish that this place was closer...but then again they would be charging $19.99 for it. I would definitely return.
As everyone suggests the Oxtail soup is very good as my wife tried and liked, not loved. I had a steak that had more gristle then meat. Horrible steak.
Been going here for years and its still on point.  Recently came to the Cal and you know what I got.....of course oxtail soup!  Ever think of how many oxtails they must go through? hmm....

Two words: Oxtail Soup. 

I never thought I'd find myself standing in a line at 3AM in the morning just for this soup. Really, is it worth the wait? YES. IT IS. Don't even order anything else. I'll let you know right now that the blueberry pie is awful. Just stick with the soup.

For $9.99 you get a humongous bowl of three large oxtails, all bathing in a tasty broth with a medley of vegetables. The oxtails are meaty and fatty. Forget being prim and proper while eating. Leave your table manners behind and start grubbin'. 

Service isn't the greatest. You have to flag servers down if you need anything, because they disappear once your order has been delivered. 

The soup is what really keeps people coming back to Market Street Cafe, but if it wasn't for that, I wouldn't return. 3.5 stars.

With over 3.5 million lbs of oxtail being sold from this casino cafe within the past 40 years, you know what's good here. With that being said... It was Ok. Not the best but by far not the worst. The cilantro was a bit wilted. The rice could use improvement but if you're hungry for oxtail soup, this is the place to go to when in Vegas. Just remember, AFTER 11:00pm or before 9:00am. It gets crowded so if you're craving it now make sure to get there before 11:00pm.

SHHHH!  VEGAS'S MILLION DOLLAR OX TAIL SOUP HERE!

I don't want to blow up the spot but sharing is caring so here goes...

If you think eating a big bowl of Pho is perfect after a night of heavy drinking, imagine that satisfaction...TIMES A THOUSAND when you're eating a bowl of hot, delicious ox tail soup!  Never again will I go to Vegas w/o getting my soup fix here =)

The broth is deliciously salty and perfect, with generous portions of tender meat that falls off the bone.  (I love it when people aren't sheisty with the meat!)  They serve it with cilantro and tons of minced ginger and served piping hot.  Ask for chili on the side and dump your rice in the soup and mix and *sluuuuuuurp* GET YOUR CHOW ON.

Only $9.95 and served only at night...only catch is the time so don't forget.  Starts at midnight until 6am PERFECT for the after spot.

I love (method man voice) THE CAAAAAL!  Sure, it's packed w/ senior citizens but who better to gamble next to than some veterans??   Pit bosses and dealers here are AWESOME too friendly and chill... They comped us 3 FREE SOUPS when we spent a few hours playing blackjack =)   that was the best $100 bowl of soup I've ever had!

(get hawaiian shaved ice upstairs w/ vanilla ice cream yum for dessert)

This joint is famous for one dish above all. And rightfully so...the oxtail soup. It is fucking delicious! The soup has that rich flavor letting you know that its been simmering for hours and hours. The broth is rich, without as much grease or fat as you'd expect. Its well seasoned, and the herbs in it just add those nice little accents as you slurp it down. The meat on the bone is delicious. My fiance cleaned all of her bones bare. 

The rest of the food isn't quite as special, but isn't bad. The price is reasonable, the service is okay, its open late, and you have more of a chance of winning at the casino outside than on the strip so that's a bonus.

But seriously...oxtail soup. Bam!

4 stars for oxtail soup and saimin (oxtail served after 11pm by the way). Because what else do you eat after a night of gambling and drinking while family is in town? Lol. It always has been a comfort spot to eat at simply because I'm from Hawaii, and hearing all the pidgin and seeing all the Hawaii folks as I eat my saimin drowned in hot mustard (not the kind of hot mustard that literally tastes like mustard), causing me to put my hands on my forehead as I go into convulsion until the hotness wears out. If you know, you know what I'm talking about. Good stuff.

Lines can be pretty long but to me, for the most part...moves at a good pace. Service isn't so bad either. Out of all the million times we've been...it's been pretty personable. Never had a rude waiter/waitress. Has a decent menu similar to foods found at a Dennys or some sort. However, I'd prefer to eat here over a 'Dennys or some sort' because of the other food options like a tocino breakfast, zippys chili, and specials like their miso butterfish. Us Hawaii folks living out in the desert always appreciates some nostalgia or likeness to home. 

They have pretty good walkway space between tables so if you must bring your stroller in, don't feel afraid to do so. If you got those.humongous double side-to-side kine strollers...leave 'um brah.

4 stars for offering oxtail soup and zippys chili and zippys style spaghetti. But overall, it's a 3.5 stars spot. If you aren't in the vicinity, there's no need to rush on down...unless you're in the vicinity and you've had a night of gambling and drinking while family is in town, and need some soup to sober up. =D

Then I'd definitely recommend. Enjoy!

$9.99 for Oxtail soup. I can get the same thing and meatier for only $1.75 at Pho79 back at home.

Wow, what a disapppointment. The broth itself didn't even taste like it came from the oxtail but more like an added can of beef broth.

If you're Vietnamese and eat Duoi Bo aka Oxtail, yeah, it's pretty much that, except 4x the price and a bit bland.

They gave a scoop of rice which was interesting and threw some peanuts in there.

Service was nice.

在堪稱是不夜城的 賭城 Las Vegas，二十四小時都可以找到活動來安排，每間知名的旅館內也多有附設一些二十四小時開業的餐廳來照顧旅客們，提供他們一個在深夜中飢腸轆轆時可以用餐的 宵夜好去處 Late Night Food。這間位於賭城老城區內的 加州旅館 The California Hotel，雖然跟主街上新穎旅館相比已經顯得有些老舊，但是在其內附設的 Market Street Cafe 餐廳，卻有一道讓食客們口耳相傳、只有在深夜十一點至隔日早上九點限時提供的美味餐點，就是採用大量牛尾與蔬菜熬至精燉而成夏威夷風味的牛尾湯。

這裡是一間早期開業、對照賭城大街上那些新穎旅館比較老舊的旅館，但大量採用許多白光燈具照明的設計，剛從停車場的電梯走出來時還有些刺眼，卻也讓人不太會感受到老舊感的安排。

賭場內各處也都是懸掛著牛尾湯的廣告看板，其受歡迎的程度可想而知，好在是造訪當晚並沒有碰到需要排隊的狀況。

原本應該也是自助餐設計的用餐空間，實際上的座位都還蠻寬敞的，如果是單人用餐的話坐在吧臺也是別有風味。

在夜間接近午夜造訪，相信多數人也都是為了這幾道特別以手寫方式呈現，只在每天晚上十一點到隔日早上九點提供的特別餐點，尤其是聲名遠播的牛尾湯。

種類五花八門、包括多種美式與夏威夷風格的菜單內容，保證對第一次來訪的朋友們是需要花點時間詳看的，可以點小圖放大看詳細內容。

想吃飽或是想吃巧，建議還是在造訪前先在心裡頭計畫一下，免得看到菜單時無法做出決定。

菜單上豐富的餐點種類確實會讓人眼花撩亂，建議把目光鎖定在這幾道只要在晚間十一點至隔天早上九點有提供的特餐內容。

雖然是在午夜過後的宵夜時段造訪，但喝杯咖啡來當作飲料提神，等等繼續再接再厲來在賭場中度過夜晚也是許多人的夜晚活動安排，這裡提供的是可續杯的美式咖啡。

點用綜合的湯麵在送上桌時是一碗上投放滿綠油油波菜葉、讓人摸不著頭緒的料理。將上方的生菜葉攪拌入湯汁後，裡頭包括叉燒、魚板、餛飩等豐富的用料，讓這一碗麵食從看似只是在家中可以料理的泡麵成為了一道在餐廳中廣受歡迎的 Comfort Food。

盼望好久終於在眼前出現的招牌牛尾湯，色澤釉黑卻清澈的湯頭來自熬煮牛尾與蔬菜多時的精華，來自香料與蔬菜的加持更讓牛尾肉吃來鹹香又帶有甜度，軟嫩的肉質與膠質更是讓人拿著牛尾骨部份猛力吸食的好滋味，確實是有其獨特的魅力，尤其是在深夜之中更顯得美味。

隨著湯品附上的還薑末、香菜、與滿滿的白飯，讓這碗湯品不只是能透過溫度與香氣帶來讓人滿意的微笑，實際上也有能帶來十分扎實的飽足感。

要價只要美金＄6.99的紐約克牛排，還富有青豆跟馬鈴薯泥，比起一份速食店的漢堡套餐還便宜，可惜點用五分熟肉質相當乾柴，如果不是特別想吃肉的話，還是建議把有限的肚皮空間用來完整地感受牛尾湯或是其它夏威夷風味美食的滋味。

大口吸食著泡麵的舒暢口感，眼中盯著碗裡五顏六色的配菜，不花俏卻充滿溫度的享受，讓人帶著溫暖與飽足感來進入夢鄉。

滿滿的肉香與豐富的膠質口感，無論是在酒國中拼搏後慰勞肚皮、或只是純粹在一個失眠的夜晚中想要感受一些溫暖，來這吃碗料好實在的牛尾湯吧。

What's not to love about this place??   The menu has just about everything you could want!!!  ......breakfast items, burgers, sandwiches, prime rib, steak, "Hawaiian food", etc.   And as mentioned, the oxtail soup is great!!   The lines are usually pretty long for this place, especially late at night, and I think it's because it's one of the few places in Downtown that's open all night.   Not to mention that the Cal and Main St. usually give out coupons for this place to certain guests.   And did I mention the cheap prices???

They also have a breakfast buffet that isn't bad.   Good but not great.

A line at 1:00 am on a Friday?! Daaaang this ox tail soup better be worth it! Line moves fairly fast, service was okay-just don't expect too much, and the prices are decent. Supposedly if you have some kind of coupon book it's pretty much almost free for a lot of things(all the Hawaiian tourists):

Came here with 2 other couples and here's what we ordered:

- (2) oxtail soup: I only tried a spoonful but the broth was flavorful, generous portion of the oxtail itself. Tender, fall off the bone goodness was the consensus. Was it worth it? Yea for $10.99-not bad

- chili and rice: this was good, I thought it had too much beans but that's just a personal preference. I don't know what Zippy's is but supposedly that's who makes it(?)

- New York steak: comes with a side of green beans(probably from a can) and mash potatoes with gravy. Cooked medium rare. I didn't try it but bolt other said it was Meh. 

- Won Ton Min: Saimin with pork dumplings-I didn't try it but the friend said the won tons tasted like a ball of "dough" nothing special 

- Island short ribs: braised ribs in their homemade house sauce. Omg this was soooooo good! Super tender and flavorful. Served with rice and canned green beans. The mister devoured it.

Give it a go!

Took my daughters here on a recent trip & we all loved it! Dinner is dirt cheap, but the food is really good, not greasy.  If you get the special you'll have soup or unlimited salad bar (simple but nice-some romaine would be nice but it's iceberg).  You get a potato, veggies & Cherries Jubilee for dessert!  $7-9, wow.  It's usually busy but worth the wait.  If you're looking for elegant or people hanging on wires to get your wine from the top of a wall, this is NOT the place.  If you want simple food at a great price, downtown, then this is THE place.

Yummmm come here for their oxtail soup! Lots of meat, I can only finish it if I share it. Best cure after a long night out. So thankful this place is open 24/7 and right next to the Plaza Hotel (which I seem to always end up staying over at).

every time i head to vegas, this place is usually the first place i stop by to grab a bite to eat. always great for the after drinking events to satisfy any drunken huger. food is fantastic, ox tail soup, food for the soul. this place is a hidden gem and is in my opinion better than 99% of the places found on the strip
You gotta get the oxtail soup. I always make it a point to stop by when I'm in town. Drink all night and wake up like a champ. Never actually ordered anything else.
I like this place for the prime rib (from 4p-12a), teri burger, salad bar and their graveyard specials... oxtail soup & NY steak (green beans)! Always a line though.

I was first introduced to the graveyard specials about six years ago. They have ox tail soup for $9.99 and NY steak for $4.99 (I think..). I never even tried ox tail before in my entire life, but their soup is sooo good!!

The thing is they are only selling these items during their graveyard special, which is form 11 PM to 9 AM. Right before 11 PM hits, there will be a long line of people waiting to be seated for the specials. The hostess usually is not the nicest, but our interaction is only about 10% of the time we are there.

I'm pretty sure they up the price since six years ago, but the quality and the quantity of the ox tail soup is the same. The broth is so rich and it's perfectly paired with mushroom, celery and carrots. I can't really finish the whole portion, so you can definitely share - just get an extra rice. Ask for hot paste too and dump it in the soup, with the ginger juice. 

Definitely one of the things I have to do when I'm in Vegas.

All I can say is... BEST OXTAIL SOUP in Vegas!!! And also for a VERY GOOD price! It's the place to find some Zippy's chili too by they way. =) The other local hawaiian food on the menu is good as well.  Great salad bar.  Staff is always friendly.  The only thing about this place is that the oxtail soup comes out ONLY @ 11pm.  Would be nice to drop by anytime of the day to eat it whenever you want.

went there today for lunch and it was HORRIBLE....the hostess was great took us straight to our seats along with 3 other sets of customers...the other three sets got their drinks and food before anyone even came over to help us...I ordered the two cheese mushroom burger with onion rings...20 minutes later here comes my food...1 type of cheese, cold burger, NO onion rings...and my refill of pepsi was rootbeer. when i said um these are fries the waitress said oh we dont have onion rings. The fries tasted like it was sitting on the counter for a while. Needless to say we left no tip and well not go back.

As with all other restaurants in DT Vegas, this is another good cheap option to eat at. Everyone comes here for the Oxtail Soup though - and it is delish! $9.99 only but I believe it is only served between 9PM-11PM.

This restaurant is open 24 hours a day.  Which is so convienent for the late night or early morning gamblers.  Located on the 1st floor of the Cal hotel next to the escalators. If you have coupon books use it here for free meals or a cheaper one.  They have a wide variety of food to choose from. 
The staff are friendly we had a party of 13 and they seated us within 15 minutes out so we were on two tables but by each other.  
The food was okay but not anything I would rave for.  I hear this is the place for oxtail soup,  I'm not a fan so I don't know.  
Prices are reasonable.

Shame on this place.. The waitress we had were absolutely rude!! Didn't even eat here because the moment the waitress seated us she had a TERRIBLE attitude.. We never got her name honestly.. She was Asian (like phillipino Asian)and just a horrible person.. I hope they fire her! I would put less stars if possible because of her.

Came here for my first ox tail soup experience and it was beyond delicious. I'm so lucky my friends knew of this place! We hadn't even been drinking, so you know this is a genuine review ;) The soup was comforting without being heavy and the meat was so tender. The serving is generous so my husband and I shared and still didn't finish all the meat. I was so sad to let some go, but at least we felt we got our money's worth which is always a nice feeling in Vegas. 

Tip: it's only served between 11pm and 5am so make sure you schedule your day right. Some of our fellow travelers missed out because they thought they could come during the day.
You got to try their Philippine Breakfast, Sweet BBQ pork "tocino" with 3 eggs and rice. And Their oxtail soup is ok.

I love this place. The lines can be a bit long, but there are ways around that. :) I always get the oxtail soup as it's a perfect balance of flavor with lots of meat. It's amazing late at night (if you can get here from the clubs) or as a good hangover chaser (but get here early as they stop serving at 11am or when it's out. It's usually gone before 11).

If you're here by yourself or just a pair just walk in and sit at the coffee bar as it's self seating there otherwise you may need to sit for a while. Just a warning that service is very spotty here. I've had great to pretty poor. It's very inconsistent.
Cheap prime rib special. Good for the price. When it's busy, it'll be a little wait. Other than that the food is good.

The best deal for breakfast! $6.95 for the luau buffet, you get the buffet, coffee and a Hawaiian sun juice. So worth it! Portuguese sausage corned beef hash bacon and my favorite, the soft scrambled eggs. Lots of other stuff too, but those are what I come here for.

After leaving the club at 4 am, someone said "ox-tail soup!".  Oooh, that sounds good.  And we were off to downtown Vegas.  I hardly ever venture to the old Vegas but this was some good soup that was perfect after all the drinking we'd done.  Market Street Cafe is located inside the California Casino.  It's open 24 hours.  Place is clean and service is quick.  Food is cheap compared to what you find on the Strip.  Ox-tail soup was bomb dot com!!

Came here again last night around 3am for some much needed hangover prevention food. 5 stars for the oxtail soup - seriously the first spoonful made me feel instantly better and I woke up this morning feeling tired but otherwise fine. Best after drinking food ever.

We've eaten here a number of times until we found Aloha Specialties upstairs. The late night menu wasn't worth it. People line up at 11 PM for the $4 steak and $8 oxtail soup, both not worth the wait. We also tried the $6 breakfast buffet which was just ok. I remember the Portuguese sausage, but that's about it. If I knew there was a fast casual place where you didn't need table service and cheaper, I wouldn't have eaten here. They're just fortunate the Hawaiians here just want food to remind them about home.

Oxtail Soup Special located inside the California Hotel/Casino
Late night restaurant, well-priced diverse menu, plenty of seating..

After a drunken night in Vegas my friend and I decided to check out MSC.  "12th st. and Ogden" is where the navi directed us and our cab driver who spoke very little English dropped us off on Main and Ogden.. he would not take us any further down what he described as "no no homeless drugs and criminal - danger!" After several failed attempts at finding help.. a janitor offers to give us a lift on his flatbed.  The  dropped us off on 6th and Ogden and having grown up in LA, we figured we'll just walk 6 blocks in the ghetto - no big deal.  chain fences, 7th st.,  guard dogs, 8th st.,crack houses, 9th st., blinking street lamps.. 10th st., darkness.. okay maybe our cab driver was right but we are so close.  "AY you two come here!"  we turn around and a homeless drug-addled, crazy man is running towards us. We run towards 12th street and there's nothing there!.. we loop around in an attempt to lose him and dart towards a lone security guard sitting on a bench.  Well anyways around 6:00 AM we somehow make it to the Market Place Cafe inside the California hotel located on the corner of Main and Ogden.  It was a fun adventure, the food could've been a little better but the price is right and the atmosphere is warm and comforting especially in this lonely city of sin.

Welcome to the hotel california!!! Market Street cafe is located in this iconic (and locals only it feels like) hotel. My mom and I needed dinner ASAP right after our flight and everyone on our plane and shuttle was raving about the oxtail soup. 

Walked in around 1130 and was still able to order it so don't be discouraged! The wait for parties 2+ seemed a bit longer since we were led to a table right away. 

Service was pretty mediocre, it took 10 minutes before someone even greeted us and another 5 just to order. Also if you're used to drinking fresh water in Hawaii I beg of you not to drink the water here!!! I thought people were over exaggerating when they said it tasted like pool water but seriously... it 1000% does, yuck. My throat still feels nasty.

The oxtail soup had a massive amount of tender, fatty oxtail compared to Hawaii where it's so expensive and you only get a few pieces. The soup was average and the veggies weren't cooked cooked long enough, bummer for all you mushy veggie lovers like myself! The cost definitely outweighs all the cons - only $10 for this huge bowl of awesomeness.  Perfect dish to regain energy and warmth :)

All in all its a great bang for your buck, not sure if I'll I'll be coming back since there's so many other unique restaurants to try in Vegas. But if you're in the mood for something familiar and comforting (all my Hawaii peeps) I recommend this place!
Two words: Oxtail soup.  Enough said.

Can you say "Oxtail Soup"? Boy I want to rate this place just based on their Oxtail Soup, but it sure wouldn't be fair. This place would seriously get 4 stars just based on Oxtail Soup alone, but a rating does consists of other things too if it is a restaurant. 

Service was OK = 1 star (I can't say they were extremely nice, but they weren't rude and plus it was also packed when we were there after hours)

Food = 1 star (downside is that out of all the times I've been here, I've only ordered the oxtail soup, rating isn't based on anything else)

Food Prices = 1 star (Decent and not over priced if you come here during graveyard hours, prices are even cheaper)

There's my 3 stars I really wish I can rate it better but it is a restaurant and I should rate it as a restaurant. Maybe sometime I will come back and try something different, but I'm not sure I will try something different as long as they keep oxtail soup on the menu.

Waited over 10 minute just to order. Sitting at the counter and no server. Finally server comes to counter and takes order from people who have just sat down after me.  

Once I placed my order she rushed through and I ha d to call her back to add an additional item to my order.  

Very very bad service......  SERVERS NAME IS BRENDA. WORKING THE COUNTER

We came here around 10:30 PM for the oxtail soup special. The deal doesn't start til 11PM so we tried to sit down first, however, the hosts could not sit us til five minutes til 11 which kinda sucked. When 10:40 approached, the lines grew and even after we finished our meal there was still a line. 

My first time I came here the special was only $5.99 but now the price rose to $9.99. This soup is worth it though! If you never had oxtail soup before, I would advise you to try it here! Their broth is full of flavor and the meat is tender and juicy! This dish is totally worth your money! 

The only complaint I have is that some of the workers are rude, but not all of them! I only tried one dish here and I would definitely come back here my next trip to Vegas!
11pm... Friday night special... oxtail soup... flavor with the onions and ginger... meat so tender it falls off the bone... my mouth is watering as i write this... thank you California hotel

Oxtail soup only offered between 11pm - 9am. Is it worth waiting for? Eh wouldn't go out of my way to come get the soup. 

Located inside the California Hotel in Downtown Las Vegas at the Market Street Cafe. 

Come here between 11pm - 9am for their graveyard specials. NY steak for like $7. Oxtail soup for $10.99. I had heard so much about their oxtail soup so I had to try it. Around 1030pm people are already lining up for the oxtail soup. The soup was lukewarm so definitely ruined the whole experience. I like my soups boiling hot. Aside from that they are very generous with the portions of oxtail. The oxtail is huge and very tender. The broth was clear and flavorful. It comes with a side of rice. Definitely should substitute it with ramen instead ! 

My bf ordered the Oriental Soup combo. Comes with noodles, wontons, fish cakes and vegetables. The broth was savory. 

Overall the food is okay. The prices are very reasonable. Their service is okay. Cant expect much because they are always so busy. If im in the area I might give it another try but I wouldn't make the drive out here if I was staying on the strip. 

Parking is $3 I believe. Remember to get your parking ticket validated if you eat here. So you can save yourself $3 and spend it on a margarita at the sports bar inside the hotel !!

Came here with three guys at around 3 AM on a Saturday. There was no line since we went there pretty late (or early, depending on how you look at it).  We were all starving. 

Two guys got steak, one got the oxtail soup, while I got the BLT. The food took a bit longer than expected, but I liked what I got. Their saimin was apparently incredibly salty that night, so I guess be warned in case you plan on getting that. The steak was decent for being $4+, according to the guys. Really, you can't expect too much. The oxtail soup was really good, according to my friend, and from the broth that I tasted, I would have to agree with him. It's apparently what they are known for.

There are so many different things on the menu, I'd have to come back and check them out. The chili with rice is calling out to me.

After a night on Fremont St. at 2 AM, a bowl of oxtail soup is as good as it gets. We had a 5 minute wait at the most to get in and no complaints with the service. 

The soup was the perfect ending to a great night. The vegetables were soft, the meat  fell off the bone, and the cartilage at the ends of the bones was jelly. After I cleared some space at the top of the bowl by slurping some of the broth and removing the bones (8), I ordered another order of rice and put it all in the soup. I took my time and  spent the next 20 minutes savoring each spoonful of my oxtail/rice soup.

This will continue to be choice A if I find myself downtown late night.

I always stay at the Cal during the LVI tournament. One of our traditions is to always end up at Market Street, eating oxtail soup, at some point during the night. It's amazing and worth the wait if you get there during the dinner rush.. But it's equally good in the middle of the night! :)

My boyfriend and I love coming here for their prime rib special. You get a huge slice of prime rib, green beans, your choice of mashed potatoes, baked potato, or rice, and cherries jubilee for dessert. It is worth the $8, trust me. 

Their prime rib is very juicy and flavorful. The mashed potatoes are my favorite because of the gravy! it is pure deliciousness. My favorite part about the cherries jubilee is the little cookie that they serve with it. Put some of the ice cream on it, and you're in for a real treat!!

If you don't feel like eating prime rib, try some of the local food they have on the menu. Definitely worth it. 

Tip: be prepared to wait for at least 15 minutes. There is usually a long line, so I wouldn't come here if you are looking to eat right away.

cheap, good, late night food. try the oxtail soup!! the won ton saimin was good too. it's a $20 cab ride from the strip and the downtown area is a little sketchy looking (compared to the strip), but if you have a car, go for it! the oxtail soup is only served from 11pm-11am, though.

It was my first time going to Vegas of age. We arrived in Vegas at approximately 1 am and the place we went to was this place. I was told a lot of the locals eat here, so I already felt kinda special. 

I ordered the oxtail soup, which happened to be a hit at that hour. They have a lot of good specials, which I had trouble deciding on. I went with the oxtail soup cause I hardly see it on menus.

The consistency of the soup was good and it was flavorful as well and they weren't shady with the oxtail. Also, the waiters were really nice and quick on their feet.

After that really late night dinner, I decided to play some slots, I was feeling good. So, I put in a 20 dollar bill into some random slot machine and on my last credit, I won 600 bucks!!! I cashed out immediately and decided to take my luck on a different machine and decided to only put five in and again, on my last credit I won $100 and I cashed out immediately.

I came out fully satisfied with the service and my food and hey, an extra 700 to spend on the rest of your vacay in Vegas doesn't hurt at all!

We went straight for the oxtail soup and the chicken curry stew.  Perfect after a night out!  I preferred the oxtail soup.  The curry was like something straight out of the box and I like it with more complexity and more kick.  The service was friendly, quick, and affordable - no frills.  

TIP: You'll need a taxi or a car to visit this cafe in the California Hotel if you're staying near the Strip.

I'd have loved to give them a 4 or 5 star but just went to have their breakfast buffet I always look forward to getting upon arrival to Vegas and was greatly disappointed. No more Portuguese Sausage or Pork links and quality of the food has gone down greatly. Even bacon was soggy not crispy as I remembered it. Used to also come with toast and now it diesnt. I was so disappointed to bite into the sausage to realize it was kelbasa. I do still love their Midnight Graveyard Special so I'll leave it at 3 stars. Hoping I won't be disappointed when I go for that at least, another tradition when I come to Vegas.

The best Oxtail Soup in town! Everybody orders it from 11pm until 5am. All entrees including oxtail soup are all under $10. Nobody can beat that, can't they? Although you may have to wait in line even in the wee small hours of the morning, once you're seated all you can think of and smell is this brim-filled hot soup generously filled with (what else) perfectly cooked fall-off-the-bone-tender-meat, carrots, celery, and peanuts just enough for texture. Along with the soup comes a generous side of steamed rice, shredded ginger and chopped cilantro leaves. Yummy!
My favorite comfort food in the heart of Las Vegas!

Visit: 5/14/09 - Late Snack.  Ate Won Ton Min & Ox Tail Soup.

Won Ton Min was okay.  It was late and we were tired. 

Ox Tail Soup was not so good.  The soup was okay, but the ox tails were bad.  Didn't fall off the bone like we expected.

Service was bad.  They were slow and grouchy.  If they are grouchy because it's busy, don't blame it on me.  Just be thankful that you have job.

I don't want to come back here, but if I have the hawaiian coupon again I will.
Nice diner type food tucked in the back of the hotel. Our waitress was very nice.  Quick in and quick out

What a pleasant surprise, great food at good prices in a very unimpressive old coffee shop atmosphere. Prime Rib was generous and perfectly prepared and the Oriental Soup Combo had great flavor in spite of mushy wantons. Salad bar was just OK, but be warned, unless its Fri night their famous Oxtail Soup isn't available till after 11pm (till 9am).

Late night clubbing, craving some late night munches.  You know what really hits the spot?  Oxtail soup.  Not just any oxtail soup though.  Don't go other places where it'll leave a "Blah" taste in your mouth.  You have to get it where it's good, and that place is the Cal ... more specifically: Market Street Cafe in the Cal.  Sure you can try other places, but trust, it ain't the same.

Granted, the first time I came here, I was "a bit" inebriated, so I didn't think writing a review with such a biased opinion would be good for my rep here on Yelp.  But trust folks, I've gone again ... this time sober ... and I can rightfully attest that the soup is the BOMB DOT COM.

For less than $10, you get a full bowl of oxtail.  I'm not talking about one or two pieces being all stingy status.  No, not here.  I believe there were at least 4 or more savory oxtails in my bowl that night.  The meat is very tender and just slides right off the bone.  Then, don't even get me started on the broth.  I could probably eat that broth alone it was so delicious.  Put a bit of rice in there, and that could be my one meal for the day.  Yes, it's that good.

One star off because the service can be a little slow at times, but given, they are busy at all times of the day.

Note: This is only a late night offer.  Don't try coming here in the afternoon to try this delicious soup.  This treat is only available from 11pm to 9am, only from the city that really does never sleep.

This place and the food is exactly how it was described - diner style comfort food in a casual setting.  Salad bar was fine - I had that for dinner.  My partner had the prime rib special for $9.99 - and he said it was delicious.  It came with potato, soup or salad bar, veggie, and dessert.

I would certainly recommend this place for a casual, decent dinner, but our wait was about 45 minutes even though they said it would be 20.

Although smoking is not allowed in the restaurant, the line for the restaurant is actually in the casino, so the smoke was HORRIBLE.  I had to stand in the restaurant (I am allergic to smoke), while my partner had to stand on line in the acrid smoke of the casino.  This is an older casino, so the ventilation system is clearly not up to the standards of the newer casinos.

The oxtail soup is sooo ono!  Probably equal to, if not better than, the oxtail soup at Kapiolani Coffee Shop back home in Honolulu.  The soup is really tasty.  The prime rib special during the graveyard shift is excellent as well.  Not sure how a place like this manages to make prime rib so tender.  Definitely worth the $8 regular price and at a Vacations Hawaii coupon plus $2 it's a no brainer!
If u come here on grave until 7am ask for Joy...great server....having saimin and Portuguese Sausage and scramble eggs....of course with rice... ono after a night out.

Worst take out experience ever. First I waited in line to order fries to go and the lady told me I had to order it at the counter when she could have told me that 5 min ago when she knew I was doing a take out. So I went to the counter and ordered my fries and stood there for about 10 min. I saw the fries come out and the lady came up to me and said I had to go pay for the fries up front. So I waited in line and told the lady I wanted to pay for my take out of fries. She said I need the receipt. I told her the lady didn't give me a receipt. She told me that I had to go get it. So I sent my boyfriend to go get it. That lady told him that she gave me the receipt when he was with me and we both know that she didn't give me the receipt. So I told the lady at the register that she didn't give me a receipt. She told me "then leave". Then the lady who took my order came up with the receipt and the French fries and said "oh I didn't give you a receipt?". So I told her no she didn't and she appologized. Then the lady at the register acted like nothing was wrong. When she literally told me to leave when my fries were already done cooking and all they needed to do was pay for it. All of this just happened about 10 minutes ago and I am very disappointed.  45 minutes waisted for just a take out of fries and rude service.  Not to be rude but some people think they can talk to you the way they want just because they are older....

While most of our trip to Vegas had been plotted, my buddies and I were left to plan our bar hopping adventure while everyone else went clubbing.  With so many bars and hotels in the area though, we figured we would just wing it and see where the alcohol took us.  The one thing we knew for sure though was our last stop of the night - Market Street Cafe's famous ox tail soup!

Now I know - when it comes to post drinking/clubbing food, the usual suspects that come to mind are classics like burgers, pizza, and burritos.  But ox tail soup?  A little unexpected...much like the line!  Parked in a corner of the California Hotel casino, it was pretty surprising to see so many other people there.  I guess that just shows how popular they are for late night eats.  

The roughly 20 minutes it took for the three of us to get a table seemed agonizingly long since we were so hungry, but the wait was worth it.  None of us really had any expectations, but we all thought it was pretty solid (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pd2Xo1WqNic9zxLTVdilGA?select=nkKSBXcNq1bxA1jC_6wCZQ).  The meat tasted great and it was oh so tender - so easy to pull it off the bone!  The broth was flavorful despite being on the lighter side, but I thought it could have used a little more richness to it.  Still, not too bad as it was.

The rest of the menu looked decent from what I saw, and I especially liked how it offers so many island/Hawaiian dishes (they have saimin!).  Definitely a good late night food option, but it's a shame that it's not closer to the Strip!  Then again, if it was, the lines would just be that much longer...

Try their butterfish special. Watch out for the small bones. Other than that it's very tender and juicy! Surprisingly their chinese chicken salad had a lot of meat and their sauce was amazing. I was surprised that I was so full from just the salad itself. The ambiance is really nice. Although you have to wait 10 minutes, it's worth it for their delicious specials!

Market Street Café here in Vegas located inside the California Hotel & Casino is so awesome! Open 24 hours offering delicious Hawaiian food and breakfast buffet for under $10, you will feel like you hit the jackpot! 

It's a tradition that my family and I come here on Tuesday mornings for their yummy breakfast buffet. Why Tuesday? Because coming to Vegas Columbus day week early Monday morning has been a tradition for us for the past few years. On Tuesday, the boys hit up the golf course while the ladies hit up downtown Vegas for good food and fun slots!

Breakfast buffet is under $10 a person and offers a variety of stuff to choose from: Ham, sausage, eggs, rice, bacon, biscuits, gravy, hash browns, fruits, corned beef hash, oj and coffee...oh my! One plate and you're stuffed (unless you're like me and must have two plates!). There is usually a wait in the morning but it goes by pretty fast. The food is good for being under $10. It's not to die for and not the best or gourmet type but it's good. 

I typically waddle out of here and waddle my way to the bar for a bloody mary...then I waddle my way to a slot machine and stay put for about an hour. That's when you know you're in food coma!

I'm happy with this place and I shall return later this year! See you in October!

My faveeeee in vegas for oxtail soup!!! It's the best late night spot for grubs when ur hungry or hungover or drunk or sober haha. Cheap prices variety on the menu but for me I go their for one thing and one thing only. Oxtail soup. Bomb!!!

This review is solely for Nancy, the supervisor for this restaurant. We came in at 1am on a weekday and they ran out of oxtail soup. We asked politely how'd they run out so fast (which they usually don't) and she started flipping out and called security on us. This was seriously the most unprofessional demeanor a supervisor has ever bestowed. She started talking amongst herself and getting crazy. Anyway, if you ever bump into this lady, beware... The security was even mentioning to us that she always calls security on any little incident. They too were mentioning that she was crazy and a waste of time when security is called.

Other than that, the oxtail soup is normally delicious. But because we received improper service and rude attitude from Nancy, we will not return again.

I never fail to visit the place everytime im in Las Vegas
Huge asian hawaiian  fussion restaurant that is open 24 hours,located in the famous but already old hotel and casino.

This place is famous for the oxtail soup,very very tender and the broth is so delish,the dish only serves by midnight but all the rest of the food in the menu you can order in 24 hour kinda thing.

Most attendants are asian,very friendly and effecient...well its the oxtail that counts no matter what..

For people who will galivant in Vegas check out this place and if you eat oxtail well this is the best place..

Great memories here and love this place... I haven't been back to this place in years.  

The prices are reasonable and the portion size are huge!! If your into Hawaiian/Filipino/Japanese food this place will be your spot. Lines are long during the late evening through early mornings so be prepared to wait.

My favorite place to go in LV for comfort food Hawaiian style. Can't go wrong with the Prime Rib Special for $9.99...it comes with the salad bar & Cherries Jubilee Ice Cream desert. I also like the T-Bone steak & the Country Fried Steak. The salad bar is decent...overall good food for the value! Need I say more

All this time living in Vegas and eating at The Cal, this was my 1st and, surely, not my last time eating here. 

I came one morning and ordered a bento. As I ordered, the cook told me that the wait might be 20 mins as he had to take care of a large order before mines; I was fine with it as I had some time to kill. 
As I waited, a seriously line of old Asian ladies came in behind me. I wasn't sure if I was supposed to stay in my spot in line or move forward and pay.
After it seemed like the large order prior to mines was done, the cook looked at me and I said, "do I stay here and wait for my order or move forward and pay?" He said, "oh, you didn't move up in line?" I said, "no because I wasn't sure...it was my first time here..." 
He motioned me towards the cashier and asked if I wanted a drink. I said, "yes, a pepsi!" 
He came to the front with my bento and pepsi in hand. I asked him how much it was and it said it was "on the house!" 
WOW!!!! That was really nice of him. I gave him whatever tip/dollar bills I had. 

Other than the service, my bento was ONO. Chicken katsu and spam :) the teri beef was more like teriyaki steak...not the kind of thinly sliced teri beef I'm used to, to which I normally don't care for anyways. And in this bento, their teri beef was my favorite part of the dish. 



I wanna try their Saimin next!

OX TAIL SOUP?! If you're a Vegas regular you know what you want as a late -night meal...that's right OX TAIL SOUP.  You can only get it from 11pm-11am at the Californian Hotel.  

You get a generous portions of ox tail in the soup with veggies, finely minced ginger, and a scoop of cilantro.  You also get a big scoop of rice. I'm usually too full from just the ox tail and soup, i don't even touch the rice. 

Another favorite after hours meal is the LocoMoco - hawaiian favorite of rice with two eggs, meat patty, and gravy.  Those are the only two items I've tried here, so this review goes to them. 

Giving it 4 stars because although the soup is only $10, you need to take a $25 cab ride from the strip to get to the restaurant.  And that means about $50 for round trip. So make sure you gamble a little before you leave to try to earn that cab fare back!

The 5 start rating is for the Oxtail Soup.  I've been eating this soup for the past 13 years.  After driving 5 hours from San Diego to Las Vegas, I make a stop to eat oxtail before I do anything else.  They only serve it around 11pm -9am.  You get a big bowl of several oxtail bones in broth, with carrots, celery, peanuts and chinese mushrooms.  It comes with 2 scoops of steamed rice and a little ground ginger and minced cilantro which you add to your soup once you get it.  Kinda like adding basil leaves and bean sprouts in your bowl of pho.  On weekend nights, the line is 20-30 mintues long depending on when you get there.  It's worth the wait.

WHO: Anyone & everyone. As a matter of fact, bring the entire family!

WHEN: I believe this Cafe is open 24 hours a day? Correct me if I'm wrong please!

WHERE: Downtown Las Vegas inside the California Hotel.

WHY: Personally... OXTAIL SOUP!

WHAT: One random night while my family was in town. We were stuck in a situation, and the situation being... WE DIDN'T KNOW WHERE TO EAT!! 

A light bulb must have lit up in one of my cousin's heads when she mentioned we get the infamous OXTAIL SOUP FOR ONLY $9.99! It was a unanimous decision, so this is where we went.

They have one of the best graveyard deals ever! You cannot get oxtail soup for 9.99 anywhere! The catch is, it starts at 11pm to 4am I believe? I came here on a whim another time during the day and was bummed because they didn't offer it. It is specifically on the GRAVEYARD menu. Unfortunately, we weren't able to get anything else because our tummies were QUITE SATISFIED. The soup comes with a bowl of rice, which is the filling part. SO GOOD!

I will go there soon and try the other tasty meals they have! The menu looks bomb! HAWAIIAN FOOD FOR THE WIN! =) But in meantime, if you are looking for a late night grub after the clubs, this has to be it!!

I will leave you with this...


OXTAIL SOUP!

Preparing to leave for an early morning flight home, I chose the Market Street Café because it was convenient to my hotel next door Main Street Station. (See review). Because of my underwhelming experience with the Portuguese sausage at the Garden Court Buffet (see review), I asked my server if it was spicy as I prefer it. She couldn't say for sure as, not surprisingly, both hotels used the same product but encouraged me to try it anyway. So I ordered that along with a stack of pancakes. As it turns out, the sausage was pretty good while the pancakes were just okay. The meal did serve its purpose, keeping me filled for several hours. 

If you're already staying at the California or Main Street Station, or just went on a long gambling run at either, it's probably a decent, convenient choice to get some grub. I just won't order the pancakes again! LOL

Reduced to 3.75 rating.  I'll still travel across the city the eat here. But the last few times I've been here the quality of the food and service has been below what I'm use to here.  Twice I've gotten the prime rib and both times it was dry and like rubber. The salad bar is still good except they've changed the crab salad recipe which sucks and that's usually the main reason I get the salad bar.  The Korean chicken was terrible also, tasted and looked like microwaved chicken dipped in hot sauce. The saimin is still good especially in this cold. Oxtail soup is still the winner and my favorite.

oxtail soup.

rich, salty, and oily.  so perfect at 2am.

i do have to admit that this is more of a hawaiian style oxtail soup, not korean style.  

oh yeah, this soup is best with the ginger that comes on the side... and also.. with rice.

2 stars for buffet but 4 for menu items with a Hawaiian flair.   Not sure where else you can get a Loco Moko for breakfast (beef patty over rice,  gravy,  with easy over eggs on top!) And inexpensive. ..  Most items under $7!

Since Candace C. swears by this place, I decided to check it out this weekend. 

Things to know:
1) open ALL NIGHT LONG: great for if you're hungry after a night of dancing, just take a cab here. It's WAAYYY down the strip 

2) HAWAIIAN FOOD!: they have spam and eggs, saimin, and loco moco!! definitely, gonna try this next time

3) OX TAIL SOUP: have to say, this thing was DELICIOUS!!! It's gingery so if you don't like ginger, don't order it. It even comes with a side of ginger and cilantro. It's warm and the meat is soft. Really, it's the perfect meal after a long night of singing along to your favorite DJ's songs 

4) LINES GET LONG!: we waited for half an hour at around 3am...yah....probably only gets worse the later it gets

Loved this place! The place is a little run down, but it's really good! I'd definitely come again if I was willing to make the trek. Oh, and if you do decide to come here, there's validated free parking!

Whenever I'm in Vegas, I always eat here at least once or twice.   Since the Cal is my casino of choice when staying in downtown, it is super convenient for me since it is located on the bottom floor, right near the west tower elevators.    The food is pretty good.  They have a prime rib special which comes with soup or salad bar, vegetables, starch (I always go with rice), a cherries jubilee dessert and of course, prime rib.   They have also have a breakfast buffet that runs until about 11am.   Some selections include eggs, rice, Portuguese sausage, French toast strips, bacon, and biscuits.  I think there are a few more items but I can't recall it at the moment.   I would be  remiss to not mention their oxtail soup which is what they are famous for.   With that being said, I must admit that I have never had it before.

Cafe closes for deep cleaning every other Tuesday from 10:20pm to 6am. During this period they offer to serve a limited menu upstairs in the Ohana conference room. It's great that they keep up with their sanitation standards but unfortunate for us it was occurring during our visit. 

So this review is solely based on our dining experience on this occasion.

First, all guests were told they'll begin serving in the Ohana room at 11pm, instead doors didn't open until 11:15pm...bad

The seating in the Ohana room was arranged in banquet style round tables so we had shared a table with 2 other parties.....it was a good 15 minutes before everyone around the table got use to it

When my highly anticipated bowl of Oxtail arrived, it was only 3 pieces of oxtail with lukewarm broth, it was a disappointment.  I asked the waitress what happened to the peanuts, celery and carrots? She said "peanuts was no longer served in soup due to allergy reasons". So why the missing vegetables?  We couldn't help but noticed that other later patrons had the veggies in their oxtail soup....BAD

Then half way thru my soup, our waitress came back with a bowl of diced carrots and celery, claiming that the cook forgot the veggies and she offered it around our table.  She was nice about it but it was a very laughable situation.  We also noticed they were carting in many bowls of oxtail soup to a corner microwave to be reheated. Really? Granted there was no kitchen nearby, so this whole setup was a bad dining substitution. 

Market street cafe would retain a better reputation by staying completely closed on cleaning Tuesdays rather than attempting to serve the general public in a chaotic unorganized manner.

Over the years this place continues to get worse and worse. It never started out very clean in my opinion but, it's really gross now. The furniture is covered in food and sticky no matter where you sit. The food is either tasteless or tastes off. My grandpa ordered a butterfish entree and it had a layer of mayonnaise that had solidified because it came cold. The butterfish years ago was much better quality. I visited this place last year and the fish was off tasting too but, that time it tasted like garlic and was spicy. It's supposed to taste like miso not all the flavors mentioned above. Our waiter was inattentive as well and not very friendly. He only took the orders of the males side of the table. When my mom's saimin came to the table, we each tried the broth. It was bland and similar to packaged versions. My brothers loco moco tasted like curry instead of gravy and my sandwich was covered in grease. I hope we never return here ever again. It was a bad experience.
Was not impressed by their breakfast buffet... The  gravy was over salted, the food was kind of bland, and there was not a big selection to be had.

Here is a play by play of my oxtail soup experience. First, I had a sip of the soup and I thought "Ah, it's ok". Then, I added ginger and parsley. Now, I'm thinking "Hmm. Ok, it's not too bad". Then finally, I ate everything together with the fall-off-the-bone tender meat with rice and I'm like "Holy Moly! This is so bomb!" When we finished our bowl, my boyfriend and I both wished we had gotten our own. 

Besides the oxtail soup, we did order corn beef hash that came with hash brown and eggs. The corn beef hash was actually pretty delicious and perhaps one of best I've tasted. What I really liked about it was the crispy outside. Breakfast is all day, which is nice. I never mind having breakfast for dinner. 

We did get to the restaurant before 11 p.m. We were surprised to see a long line. Lucky for us, they were seating groups of 2 so we didn't have to wait too long in that line. Service was quick and efficient. Prices aren't too bad either.

It's practically tradition for my family to come here suuuuuper late at night (either being drunk, hungry from playing too much at the casino, or bored) & grab some Oxtail soup. Yup, it's bomb, and we come here every single time we visit Vegas. I love their late night menu...so cheap & so yummy!

Cons: Big ass line at 3 in the morning. Oh well, it's worth it!

The service was great! the whole family went for brunch and the breakfast buffet. They had a good variety and it was delicious. Highly recommend the buffet but be sure to get there before 11 am to make it. We wanted to try the prime rib but didn't get around to it (served after 4:30 pm) but heard great things about it.

Great prices, okay service, diner food...

Food was below average but what can you expect from a $10 prime rib joint? The prime rib was actually decent but everything else was sub-par. The baked potatoes were clearly cooked earlier in the day and reheated for us when we ordered. The saimin was doughy and overcooked.
